intro: Sterculia fanaiho subsp. fanaiho, commonly known as the Fanaiho tree, is a tropical tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional practices. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts within its native habitat.
